result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas T Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • OWI (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants Huber and good time. Must report to jail today, October 23, 2015 by 12:30 PM. 
3 days credit to be applied towards conditional sentence.

supervisions.notes:
$250.00 cash bond applied. 
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

Defendant Nicholas T Goodwin in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF271, 15TR1293, 15TR1307 AND 15TR1308

11:16  Court relates and gives appearances.
11:25  State gives recommendation.
11:26  Atty. Loberg makes argument.
11:30  Nicholas Goodwin makes statement.
11:32  Court relates.

15CF271
Count #1:  State moves to amend to a class A misdemeanor fleeing 346.04(2t).  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge.  Court finds defendant guilty.
SW
1 year probation
20 days jail with credit for 3 days served, with huber and good time.  Report to jail by 12:30 pm today.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Pay court costs to be paid over period of probation
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and recommendations of PO.

Count #2 (based on refusal and on aggravated driving):  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
$1000.50 forfeiture - 60 days or payment plan.  $250 posted to apply
9 month revocation of DL
AODA
12 months IID
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.


15TR1293:  (Refusal)  Court finds unlawful to refuse.  $50 court costs and 1 year IID.  60 days to pay.

15TR1307:  State moves to dismiss.  Court grants motion.

15TR1308:  State moves to dismiss.  Court grants motion.

Defendant Nicholas T Goodwin in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CF271, 15TR1293, 15TR1307, 15TR1308.
Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas T Goodwin in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading of Information and pleads NG. Defendant also pleads NG to 15TR1307 and 15TR1308.
15TR1293: Case to be rescheduled to 9/16/15 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas T Goodwin in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. DA to notify law enforcement that motorcycle be released.  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
